tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

Here "soul" represents the writer's inner being. The writer is commanding his inner being to praise Yahweh. This can be translated as a statement. AT: "I will praise Yahweh with all my soul" or "I give praise to Yahweh with all my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"until I die" or "while I live"
Here "princes" represents all human leaders. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: in mankind, in whom there is no salvation
tn.text: The abstract noun "salvation" can be stated as "save." AT: "in any person because they cannot save you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"in humankind" or "in people"

tn.ref: When a person's life's breath stops
tn.text: This is a polite way to refer to someone dying. AT: When a person dies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This means that just as God made the first human, Adam, from the soil, so will a person's body decay and become soil again when he dies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The words "heaven" and "earth" represent everything that exists in the physical universe. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
The abstract noun "trustworthiness" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "remains trustworthy" or "remains faithful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"He decides matters fairly" (UDB)
This nominal adjective can be stated as adjectives. AT: "for oppressed people" or "for those whom other people oppress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This nominal adjective can be stated as adjectives. AT: "to hungry people" or "to those who are hungry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: opens the eyes of the blind
tn.text: Causing a blind person to see is spoken of as if Yahweh were opening the person's eyes. AT: "causes the blind to see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This nominal adjective can be stated as adjectives. AT: "blind people" or "those who are blind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down
tn.text: Yahweh helping someone is spoken of as if he were physically helping someone to stand up. AT: "Yahweh helps those who are discouraged" or "Yahweh helps those who are weak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This action is a sign of distress or mourning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
God helping someone is spoken of as if he were physically lifting them up. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here "Zion" represents all the people of Israel. The writer is speaking to the people of Israel as if they were there listening to him. AT: "your God, people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])
The words "will reign" are understood. AT: "will reign for all generations" or "will reign forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
